title: *S&PGR Places Boeing Co. Ratings On CreditWatch Negative
region: namz : North America | usa : United States
sentence: Ratings On CreditWatch Negative The following is a press release from S&P Global Ratings: -- The strike by Boeing Co.'s machinist union is in its fourth week, increasing financial risk for the company. -- We estimate the company will incur a cash outflow of approximately $10 billion in 2024, due in part to working capital buildup to support manufacturing process overhaul and costs associated with the strike. -- We believe the company will likely require incremental funding to maintain its target cash balance, fund operating and working capital, and meet debt maturities. -- Therefore, we placed the ratings on Boeing, including the 'BBB-' issuer credit rating and senior unsecured debt ratings, on CreditWatch with negative implications.
sentenceRaw: Ratings On CreditWatch Negative The following is a press release from S&P Global Ratings:         -- The strike by Boeing Co.'s machinist union is in its fourth week,  increasing financial risk for the company.       -- We estimate the company will incur a cash outflow of approximately $10  billion in 2024, due in part to working capital buildup to support  manufacturing process overhaul and costs associated with the strike.       -- We believe the company will likely require incremental funding to  maintain its target cash balance, fund operating and working capital, and meet  debt maturities.       -- Therefore, we placed the ratings on Boeing, including the 'BBB-'  issuer credit rating and senior unsecured debt ratings, on CreditWatch with  negative implications.

title: Intel 's credit rating downgraded by Fitch on demand challenges
region: namz : North America | usa : United States
sentence: "Credit metrics remain weak and will require both stronger end markets and successful product ramps, along with net debt reduction over the next 12-14 months" for Intel to recover its recent ratings, Fitch analysts wrote on Monday.
sentenceRaw: "Credit metrics remain weak and will require both stronger end markets and successful product ramps, along with net debt reduction over the next 12-14 months" for Intel to recover its recent ratings, Fitch analysts wrote on Monday.

sentence: Intel will need to ramp up its PC shipments while also reducing its balance sheet debt to recover its previous credit ratings, Fitch said.

sentence: We anticipate the equity investment, which was announced yesterday, will modestly improve Intel's credit metrics, including by reducing its S&P Global Ratings-adjusted debt leverage to 2.6x and 2.2x by the end of 2025 and 2026, respectively, from our previous projections of 2.8x and 2.4x.
sentenceRaw: We anticipate  the equity investment, which was announced yesterday, will modestly improve  Intel's credit metrics, including by reducing its S&P Global Ratings-adjusted  debt leverage to 2.6x and 2.2x by the end of 2025 and 2026, respectively, from  our previous projections of 2.8x and 2.4x.

sentence: The Transaction Agreement The Transaction Agreement provides that, subject to its terms and conditions, the Purchaser will purchase from the Sellers all of the Sellers' right, title and interest in and to, in the aggregate, fifty-one percent (51%) of the shares of issued and outstanding common stock of the Company, including all of the shares then held by Intel Americas, for a purchase price that implies an enterprise value for the Company of $8.75 billion, and which is expected to result in net cash proceeds to the Sellers of approximately $4.40 billion after adjustments for cash, debt and debt-like items, working capital, transaction expenses and other items.

sentence: Key Assumptions --Low-single digit positive revenue growth in 2025 from the PC refresh cycle and strong demand for AI PCs followed by moderated growth in 2026; --Revenue grows by the mid-single digits through the remainder of the forecast, reflecting improving competitive positioning and growth in --the foundry services business; --Gross profit margins expand to the high-30% in 2025 to the low-40% for 2026 and expanding from there from a richer sales mix; --Expanding gross margins and cost restructuring drive EBITDA margins from the mid-20% in 2025 to the mid-30% in 2026; --Capital spending is $20 billion for 2025 and gross capital intensity remains near 30%; --No dividends or stock buybacks over the next two years; --Intel repays debt at maturity over the next two years as part of its deleveraging.
sentenceRaw: Key Assumptions --Low-single digit positive revenue growth in 2025 from the PC refresh cycle and strong demand for AI PCs followed by moderated growth in 2026; --Revenue grows by the mid-single digits through the remainder of the forecast, reflecting improving competitive positioning and growth in --the foundry services business; --Gross profit margins expand to the high-30% in 2025 to the low-40% for 2026 and expanding from there from a richer sales mix; --Expanding gross margins and cost restructuring drive EBITDA margins from the mid-20% in 2025 to the mid-30% in 2026; --Capital spending is $20 billion for 2025 and gross capital intensity remains near 30%; --No dividends or stock buybacks over the next two years; --Intel repays debt at maturity over the next two years as part of its deleveraging.

title: Press Release S&PGR Downgraded Intel To 'BBB' On Slow Bus Recvry; Otlk Stble
region: namz : North America | usa : United States | usca : California | usw : Western U.S.
sentence: The company's announcement of management changes will also add to business challenges. -- Although we expect Intel's discretionary cash flow (DCF), or free operating cash flow (FOCF) less buybacks and dividends, will improve as it implements cost-saving initiatives, we forecast its DCF-to-debt ratio will be neutral in 2025 and 7% by the end of 2026, modestly lower than our previous forecast. -- Therefore, we lowered our issuer credit rating on Intel to 'BBB' from 'BBB+'.
sentenceRaw: The company's  announcement of management changes will also add to business challenges.       -- Although we expect Intel's discretionary cash flow (DCF), or free  operating cash flow (FOCF) less buybacks and dividends, will improve as it  implements cost-saving initiatives, we forecast its DCF-to-debt ratio will be  neutral in 2025 and 7% by the end of 2026, modestly lower than our previous  forecast.       -- Therefore, we lowered our issuer credit rating on Intel to 'BBB' from  'BBB+'.

title: Press Release S&PGR Downgraded Intel To 'BBB' On Slow Bus Recvry; Otlk Stble
region: namz : North America | usa : United States | usca : California | usw : Western U.S.
sentence: We would consider a lower rating if: -- The x86 CPU market weakens because of a greater-than-expected customer budget shift away from general purpose computing to accelerated computing, its competitive position in x86 CPU weakened further, or there was a lack of progress in its foundry strategy; -- We expect Intel's growth or profitability will underperform our base-case expectations, leading to weak DCF generation with limited prospects for significant improvements (i.e., DCF-to-debt reaching and sustained below 10%); or -- We expect S&P Global Ratings-adjusted leverage will remain above the 2.5x area due to either reduced profitability or higher capital spending.
sentenceRaw: We would consider a lower rating if:       -- The x86 CPU market weakens because of a greater-than-expected customer  budget shift away from general purpose computing to accelerated computing, its  competitive position in x86 CPU weakened further, or there was a lack of  progress in its foundry strategy;       -- We expect Intel's growth or profitability will underperform our  base-case expectations, leading to weak DCF generation with limited prospects  for significant improvements (i.e., DCF-to-debt reaching and sustained below  10%); or       -- We expect S&P Global Ratings-adjusted leverage will remain above the  2.5x area due to either reduced profitability or higher capital spending.

title: *S&PGR Revises Nike Inc. Outlook To Neg; 'AA-' ICR Affirmed
region: namz : North America | usa : United States | usor : Oregon | usw : Western U.S.
sentence: We still believe operating performance could deteriorate further or financial policies could change given its circumstances and a new CEO. -- We also affirmed all of our ratings on Nike, including the 'AA-' issuer credit rating and unsecured debt ratings and 'A-1+' short-term and commercial paper ratings. -- The negative outlook reflects that we could lower the ratings over the next two years if the company's revenue continues to decline and the Nike brand loses more market share, relevance, and equity with consumers due to its inability to remedy its go-to-market strategy.
sentenceRaw: We still believe operating performance could deteriorate  further or financial policies could change given its circumstances and a new  CEO.       -- We also affirmed all of our ratings on Nike, including the 'AA-'  issuer credit rating and unsecured debt ratings and 'A-1+' short-term and  commercial paper ratings.       -- The negative outlook reflects that we could lower the ratings over the  next two years if the company's revenue continues to decline and the Nike  brand loses more market share, relevance, and equity with consumers due to its  inability to remedy its go-to-market strategy.

title: *S&PGR Revises Nike Inc. Outlook To Neg; 'AA-' ICR Affirmed
region: namz : North America | usa : United States | usor : Oregon | usw : Western U.S.
sentence: Nike's 2.4% $1 billion notes will mature in March 2025, and it has approximately $1 billion of debt maturing in 2026 and 2027 each.
sentenceRaw: Nike's 2.4% $1 billion notes will mature in March 2025,  and it has approximately $1 billion of debt maturing in 2026 and 2027 each.

title: *S&PGR Revises Nike Inc. Outlook To Neg; 'AA-' ICR Affirmed
region: namz : North America | usa : United States | usor : Oregon | usw : Western U.S.
sentence: We could lower our ratings on Nike if: -- Revenue continues to decline and it continues to lose market share stemming from an unsuccessful strategy; -- We revise our assessment of its business risk profile due to permanent brand damage or loss of relevance with consumers; -- We revise our assessment of management and governance due to its controlling ownership by the Knight family and whether it prohibits the company from implementing effective strategies in a timely manner; or -- It undertakes more aggressive shareholder returns or makes a sizable debt-financed acquisition such that its leverage increases and remains above 1.5x.
sentenceRaw: We could lower our ratings on Nike if:       -- Revenue continues to decline and it continues to lose market share  stemming from an unsuccessful strategy;       -- We revise our assessment of its business risk profile due to permanent  brand damage or loss of relevance with consumers;       -- We revise our assessment of management and governance due to its  controlling ownership by the Knight family and whether it prohibits the  company from implementing effective strategies in a timely manner; or       -- It undertakes more aggressive shareholder returns or makes a sizable  debt-financed acquisition such that its leverage increases and remains above  1.5x.

title: Press Release Walgreens Marks One-Year Anniversary of Deans Advisory Council, Driving Progress in Addressing Pharmacy Industry Challenges

sentence: With the deans' work deeply rooted in nurturing the talent pipeline, coupled with Walgreens' extensive reach and trusted relationships, the collaboration has helped influence and deliver visible progress including: -- Launching the Walgreens Student Loan 401(k) Match Program, which helps students manage their student loan debt and invest in a secure financial future. -- Using direct student feedback, enhanced the Walgreens Pharmacy Educational Assistance Program (PEAP), providing tuition assistance each year when eligible team members are enrolled in a professional pharmacy program while working for Walgreens as a pharmacy intern.
sentenceRaw: With the deans' work deeply rooted in nurturing the talent pipeline, coupled with Walgreens' extensive reach and trusted relationships, the collaboration has helped influence and deliver visible progress including: --   Launching the Walgreens Student Loan 401(k) Match Program, which helps        students manage their student loan debt and invest in a secure financial        future.         --   Using direct student feedback, enhanced the Walgreens Pharmacy        Educational Assistance Program (PEAP), providing tuition assistance each        year when eligible team members are enrolled in a professional pharmacy        program while working for Walgreens as a pharmacy intern.

title: *S&PGR Downgrades Walgreens Boots Alliance To 'BB-'; Otlk Stbl
region: namz : North America | usa : United States
sentence: (WBA) continues to face pressure from pharmacy reimbursement, soft demand in the front-of-store, and elevated shrink, among other challenges. -- WBA's S&P Global Ratings-adjusted debt to EBITDA was 5.8x in 2024 and we now expect it will remain high above 5x well into 2026. -- Therefore, we lowered our long-term issuer rating to 'BB-' from 'BB' and our issue-level rating on the company's senior unsecured debt to 'BB-' from 'BB'. -- We lowered our issue-level rating on the company's senior unsecured debt to 'BB-'.
sentenceRaw: (WBA)  continues to face pressure from pharmacy reimbursement, soft demand in the  front-of-store, and elevated shrink, among other challenges.  -- WBA's S&P Global Ratings-adjusted debt to EBITDA was 5.8x in 2024 and we  now expect it will remain high above 5x well into 2026.  -- Therefore, we lowered our long-term issuer rating to 'BB-' from 'BB' and  our issue-level rating on the company's senior unsecured debt to 'BB-' from  'BB'.  -- We lowered our issue-level rating on the company's senior unsecured debt  to 'BB-'.

title: BUZZ-Walgreens climbs on Sycamore's take-private deal for $10 billion
region: namz : North America | usa : United States
sentence: (Updates) ** Shares of pharmacy chain Walgreens Boots Alliance rise 7.2% to $11.36 ** WBA will be taken private by Sycamore Partners for $10 billion, the firms said late on Thursday ** Sycamore will pay $11.45 per share to WBA, a premium of 8% to the company's closing price of $10.60 on Thursday ** The transaction has a total value of around $23.7 billion, including payouts and debt - Leerink Partners investment bank ** "Given the size of the deal and number of moving parts involved (a potential split of the US business, Boots, and Health), we don't expect a competing bid to come over the top" - Leerink analysts ** Stock down 49.3% in the last 12 months, up to its last close (Reporting by Christy Santhosh)
sentenceRaw: (Updates) ** Shares of pharmacy chain Walgreens Boots Alliance rise 7.2% to $11.36 ** WBA will be taken private by Sycamore Partners for $10 billion, the firms said late on Thursday ** Sycamore will pay $11.45 per share to WBA, a premium of 8% to the company's closing price of $10.60 on Thursday ** The transaction has a total value of around $23.7 billion, including payouts and debt - Leerink Partners investment bank ** "Given the size of the deal and number of moving parts involved (a potential split of the US business, Boots, and Health), we don't expect a competing bid to come over the top" - Leerink analysts ** Stock down 49.3% in the last 12 months, up to its last close (Reporting by Christy Santhosh)
